item.title: SpaceX’s Starship blows up ahead of 10th test flight
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: It's the latest in a string of setbacks for the mega-rocket, which SpaceX hopes to use to build Starlink and one day go to Mars.

item.title: Bluesky briefly suspended JD Vance’s account after he joined
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Bluesky's automated impersonation detection system took down JD Vance's new account, but it was restored soon after.

item.title: A timeline of the US semiconductor market in 2025
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: It’s already been a tumultuous year for the U.S. semiconductor industry. The semiconductor industry plays a sizable role in the “AI race” that the U.S. seems determined to win, which is why this context is worth paying attention to: from Intel’s appointment of Lip-Bu Tan to CEO — who wasted no time getting to work […]

item.title: Nvidia’s AI empire: A look at its top startup investments
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Over the last two years, Nvidia has used its ballooning fortunes to invest in over 80 AI startups. Here are the giant semiconductor's largest investments.

item.title: Stripe’s former growth lead helps African diaspora invest in startups, real estate
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: When Joe Kinvi joined Touchtech Payments in 2017 as head of finance, the Irish startup couldn’t afford his full salary. So he negotiated for stock to make up the difference. Eighteen months later, Stripe acquired the company, and that equity converted into Stripe shares, enough to let Kinvi leave his job, bootstrap a side project, […]

item.title: No, Andreessen Horowitz didn’t post that crypto scam tweet
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: If it sounds too good to be true — like a VC giving away valuable assets — it isn't true.

item.title: New code in Spotify’s app references the long-awaited ‘lossless’ tier
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Newly added references in the music app's code suggest the lossless service is at least still under development and could even be getting closer to launch.

item.title: Here are the 24 US AI startups that have raised $100M or more in 2025
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Last year was monumental for the AI industry in the U.S. and beyond. How will 2025 compare?

item.title: ‘Kid-pilled’ Sam Altman ‘constantly’ asked ChatGPT questions about his newborn
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Sam Altman, who is both the father of a 3-month-old and CEO of OpenAI, hopped on OpenAI's new podcast today to talk about how his company is impacting his experience with fatherhood.

item.title: Six-month-old, solo-owned vibe coder Base44 sells to Wix for $80M cash
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: In Base44's six months as a stand-alone company, it reportedly grew to 250,000 users and was making nearly $200,000 in monthly profits.

item.title: Multiplier, founded by ex-Stripe exec, nabs $27.5M to fuel AI-powered accounting roll-ups
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Multiplier raised Series A and seed funding from Lightspeed and Ribbit Capital.

item.title: Midjourney launches its first AI video generation model, V1
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Midjourney launched its much anticipated AI video generation model, V1, on Wednesday and laid out a roadmap for its future releases.

item.title: Voi CEO says he’s open to acquiring Bolt’s micromobility business
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Frederik Hjelm, CEO of shared micromobility startup Voi, said he sees a path to acquiring the scooter and bike operations of Bolt, the European mobility super-app best known for ride-hailing.

item.title: OpenAI drops Scale AI as a data provider following Meta deal
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: OpenAI says it's cutting ties with Scale AI following its deal with Meta, raising questions about the data provider's business.

item.title: A glitch is turning Threads into a literal echo chamber
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: A Threads glitch is making it look like everyone on your feed is saying the same thing.

item.title: xAI is facing a lawsuit for operating over 400 MW of gas turbines without permits
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The Colossus data center was allegedly operating as many as 35 gas turbines without pollution controls in a region that already had poor air quality.

item.title: Facebook will soon roll out support for passkeys on Android and iOS
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Passkey logins make it harder for bad actors to remotely access your accounts because they require physical access to your phone.

item.title: OpenAI found features in AI models that correspond to different ‘personas’
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: By looking at an AI model's internal representations — the numbers that dictate how an AI model responds, which often seem completely incoherent to humans — OpenAI researchers were able to find patterns that lit up when a model misbehaved.

item.title: Waymo has set its robotaxi sights on NYC
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Waymo said it's working on a return to New York City and its first step it applying for a permit.

item.title: Amazon’s Zoox opens its first major robotaxi production facility
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Zoox says the facility will eventually be able to pump out 10,000 robotaxis per year.
